caption: Delicious food. I had the Kielbasa Perro and the owner recommended the Colombiana to drink. Great recommendation. Nice staff and great infusion. Highly recommend this place.

The food here is absolutely amazing. We came back for the arepa-ski and emparogis, but the kielbasa perro is to die for. The desserts are very light and delicious as well.The chef and his wife are extremely sweet and they go above and beyond to make sure every need is met.

It was delicious and very affordable for the quality of the food! The emparogi and the la zapiekanka were my favorite and my partner loved the arepa ski with coffee infused short ribs.  Highly recommend!

Polish Colombian fusion that did not fail to impress! Food was great and cooled fresh. Owners were welcoming and came by to check on us throughout the visits. Will definitely return to try the other menu items.  Try the Polish Juices!

Such unique food and really tasty! We went in to pick up a paçkzi order, and ended up staying for a meal! Not only is the food amazing, but the owners treat you like you’re their best friend, which really makes for a great experience 😊
Ordered paczi for delivery.  Food wa0a delicious can't wait to try other menu items!

Such a unique concept. We ordered everything on the menu since we couldn’t decide. The flavor combos of each dish were amazing and delicious. If  I had to choose a favorite, I’d go with the Arepa-Ski. Enjoy!
Awesome original food great to see friends open up a restaurant

I'm a huge fan of Polish food. And always get disappointed when it's not as good as my mother's.  Now this place wants to come and infuse two good food types into one ?  ... Well they did it. The extra touches on the dishes I traditionally was used to was really nice.  There's some spice when you ask for it and it's good.  Which I love.  Then there's lots of extra sauce options which I'm a big fan of.  Thanks Polombia! You did not disappoint.  I definitely recommend you take a quick  gander at this new place while they're not as popular as They are going to be!!!

Couldn't decide on Polish food or Colombian food for dinner tonight so wound up on POLOMBIA's website and WOW was I in for a treat! After ordering 75% of the menu, I can confirm that you will want to eat here! We ordered the Emparogis, La Zapiekanka, Sal-CHI-Papa, and the Kielbasa Perro and everything was divine! Also very important, please order one of the Tymbark Fruit Juices, they pair wonderfully with vodka or  tequila! We will definitely be coming back here in the future.  Note: Due to the pandemic, POLOMBIA is currently partnering with a restaurant called the Outpost Mexican Eatery to serve customers on weekends through a "pop-up" arrangement. You will pick up your food at the exit door of the Outpost or you can call for curbside pick-up. The staff is SUPER friendly.

Ordered online via tock and picked up. Emparogis pictured (came with 5 but we ate one before I took the picture) but we also got a Zapiekanka which was massive and full of cheesy goodness. I loved the emparogis (who doesn't love potatoes? ♥️) and my boyfriend loved the Zapiekanka for its explosion of interesting flavors. They also threw in 3 of their little kolaczki desserts which was super nice. Bonus points for compostable takeout containers, a paper bag, and not giving us utensils/napkins as requested! It can be hard to find because there's no signage, but it's located inside The Outpost, which does have signage

Wow just wow! If you are looking for a unique place that will be your NEW favorite spot, then this is it! All of the flavors ranging from the emparogi, kielbasa perro and their Zapiekanka were all 5 stars and delicious throughout. Head out here ASAP :)
This food fusion is amazing!! Definitely going back! The food was delicious, the service is great, and would highly recommend it.

I loved Polombia! The Colombian/Polish fusion is so unique and everything we tried was absolutely delicious. From the kielbasa perro to the emparogis, you cannot go wrong with anything on the menu. The zapiekanka was my favorite thing and it is a must order. The owners are wonderful and very attentive and passionate about their business, I highly recommend trying Polombia.
Ate some amazing Polish/Colombian Fusion today! Literally everything was great. Phil is a master in the kitchen and I recommend this place to anyone visiting Chicago! PS Try the Colombian soda ;)
🔥 combinations

Polombia is a must try for everyone. The food is unique and a great fusion of two different cultures. My friend and I tried many of the dishes and they were all delicious. I highly recommend every one visit this restaurant.

I ended up ordering the arepa-ski with mojo roasted chicken and a side of golden fried potatoes. The honey ricotta and roasted chicken combo is mouth watering! The owners are very polite, passionate, and creative. Will be returning!
Such a unique concept and great food by Cynthia and Phil. These guys are amazing. I highly recommend everyone to go check out their place and great hospitality. Thanks!

Truly unique and delicious food! I was so happy to get to try this spot before the end of the season at Politan -- i will most certainly be following wherever they end up next, and dreaming of the empa-rogies until then!

Polombia was so delicious! We live just a few blocks away from Politan Row and were very excited to try this new spot. We ordered the short rib emparogis, zapiekanka, arepa-ski with coffee braised short rib, and sal-chi-papa. All were absolutely wonderful and I’m glad we got to try a bit of everything! The mixture of flavors was new, interesting and comforting all at the same time! Both of the owners came out and talked to us which was so sweet and very appreciated. We heard Politan Row is closing which makes us incredibly sad, but we’ll definitely go to wherever Polombia re-opens so we can enjoy this amazing food again!

I have never written a review before, but feel this couple really deserves praise for what they’ve made. The food is truly delicious and you can tell they’ve put their heart and soul into making this restaurant. The owners checked on us throughout the meal and genuinely wanted to make sure we were enjoying our time. I will be returning soon!

Such a great experience! This new Polish-Colombian fusion restaurant is so worth trying out. The 5 menu options all sound so delicious you just want to try them all. Tried the emparogi, sal-CHI-papa, and arepaski. All 5/5. Extremely unique dishes, and so so yummy!

Absolutely amazing taste and unique combination of polish and Colombian recipes. The owners are so nice and give personal attention to the customers! The prices are reasonable too. Please go and check it out!
Great spot and amazing food! A unique fusion you can't find anywhere else!

The food tastes 5 star quality!  I'm not an expert on Colombian or Polish food; I just like food that tastes good.  My friends and I tried everything on their menu today (zapiekanka, emparagis, kielbassa, among other things).. Everything was good.  My friends liked the emparogis the best.  The owners are extremely nice and go out of their way to be extra hospitable.

The food was delicious and novel. The service staff got us our own heater and visited our table often enough to inquire about the service and food, and offered to rectify anything if we didn't like it.
Coming from Jersey with my family! We tried a few different items on the menu and we are obsessed! Love it ❤️

Who would've thought that Polis and Colombian food would get together and be so DELICIOUS. Haven't tried everything on the menu yet but trust me I will very soon. I had the emparogi and sal-CHI-papa and OMG they were DELICIOUS. The creators of this amazing fusion Cynthia and Phillipe are amazing, spr friendly, charismatic, warm and welcoming that just makes it even better. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND trying this new fusion, you will thank me later... Oh and did I mention the food is SPR DELICIOUS?? Oh yes I did.
Excelente servicio, y deliciosa comida!! Delicious food and excellent service!! Love it, definitely coming back!
Great food! The zapiekanka and the empierogis were  delicious. Definitely coming back soon.
Great Polish-Colombian fusion concept like never seen in Chicago. Looking forward to seeing what else the team develops 🙏🏼

Highly recommend trying this cullonary fusion of Polish and Colombian kitchen. They take the best of both worlds and bring them to you eligantly on one platter. Very friendly server Cythia, and Chef is as always doing his thing in the Kitchen!
Tried few different things from the menu and enjoyed every single one of them! Extremely friendly service as well. Love the idea of Polish/Columbian fusion. Definitely will be back!
Awesome food. One of a kind
Food was sooooo good! Honestly, most unique combo. All the flavors were a perfect mix. Most favorite - the AREP-SKI!! get the chicken & short rib. So good. Def recommend checking this place out.
Seriously amazing I have not tasted anything like this.

What a great addition to Politan Row! I tried the kielbasa perro, which was a delicious twist on a traditional Polish sausage. Got to meet owners Phillipe and Cynthia, who were so sweet and welcoming. You can tell that the Polish Colombian fusion they’ve created is truly a labor of love. Already planning my next meal at Polombia, highly recommend this spot!
This place is fantastic! I love the kielbasa dog, it was truly inspired polish columbian fusion! Highly recommended

This Polish-Colombian fusion food is delicious! I heard about this new restaurant “on the block” so I went to check it out and oh boy I was not disappointed! The restaurant is located within the Politan Row chef-driven food hall. The high quality of food being served at Polombia, the presentation of the food, the thought itself of mixing Polish dishes with Colombian accents and Colombian dishes with Polish accents is an one brilliant idea (two countries in two different parts of the world, yet this fusion matches perfectly). Add a great staff members to all this and you got yourself an overall wonderful restaurant experience. There are 5 main dishes on the menu, some sides and desserts to go along and thanks to that you get to explore the passion-driven food, neatly prepared by the chef (so far my favorite is the Mojo Roasted Chicken Arepa-ski, which you have to try yourself). Even the selection of beverages  available there will let you taste either of the two countries. To sum it all, I have three adjectives to describe this restaurant: CREATIVE, INNOVATIVE, INDIVIDUAL because you will not find anything like that elsewhere, at least in Chicagoland area. Anyone that tries food from Polombia will not be disappointed! I, for sure, will be back there soon again to try some more.
